exam_papers.title: 2023年3月大学英语四级考试真题（一）
exam_papers.description: 2023年3月大学英语四级考试真题（第一套），包含写作、听力、阅读理解和翻译四个部分

exam_sections.directions: Directions: Suppose you have taken part in a career planning seminar. Write an account of the seminar and summarize what you have learned from it. You will have 30 minutes for this task and should write at least 120 words but no more than 180 words.

In this section, you will hear three news reports. At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions. Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear three passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, there is a passage with ten blanks. You are required to select one word for each blank from a list of choices given in a word bank following the passage. Read the passage through carefully before making your choices. Each choice in the bank is identified by a letter. Please mark the corresponding letter for each item on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre. You may not use any of the words in the bank more than once.
exam_sections.passage_content:
It's a fantasy that goes back centuries: a message in a bottle, carried ashore from far-off lands. Authors, artists and children ______ have dreamed of such a gift from the sea.

This time, though, it's not a bottle that washes ashore. It's eggs—thousands of little toy eggs.

That's what happened on the German island of Langeoog this week.

Lying just off the North Sea coast, it found itself ______ by an invasion of colored plastic eggs—much to the ______ of local children, because the eggs contained toys.

Police ______ the eggs came from a freighter that lost part of its cargo during an unusually ______ storm, the worst to hit Germany's northeastern coast since 2006.

At any rate, what was lost now has been found, by many of the community's littlest residents.

"The surprise eggs have found their way to freedom," said Mayor Uwe Garrel. However, the joy of the moment ___31___ off soon.

"At first, I thought this was a wonder, because everything was so ___32___, but then we realized that this is a huge ___33___ in the end," said the mayor. He also noted the plastic bags and other materials that have washed ashore on the island can cause serious problems for ___34___.

Still, all these little eggs contained an extra treat with their toys. They ___35___ notes from afar.

There was just one problem for the German children who received them: They were written in Russian.

exam_sections.directions: In this section, you are going to read a passage with ten statements attached to it. Each statement contains information given in one of the paragraphs. Identify the paragraph from which the information is derived. You may choose a paragraph more than once. Each paragraph is marked with a letter. Answer the questions by marking the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.passage_content:
A) Congratulations on deciding to get married! While being married is great and wonderful, the act of getting married can be quite stressful. There is the planning of the ceremony itself, the merging (合并) of two households and all of the details involved in that. You also have to take the time to apply for your marriage license and then decide whether or not you are going to keep your last name or change it.

B) This is where a lot of people have trouble. Once upon a time, it was just customary for a bride to take her groom's last name as her own and abandon her maiden name completely. The act of keeping her own last name was considered taboo (禁忌) and people's eyebrows would raise right off their faces when they found out that the bride was even considering something so radical. Over time, though, more and more women are deciding to keep their last names.

C) There are a lot of reasons to want to keep your own last name. Hopefully you have a supportive groom who understands why this idea is the most appealing to you. A lot of times, though, the act of keeping your name is still something that causes concern. Even if your groom is fine with it, his family (or your own) might not be so understanding.

D) There are a couple of ways to compromise on the issue. You could choose an entirely new last name for the two of you to share. This way neither of you gets "your" way and you both have to deal with the legalities of going through a name change. Most of the time, though, the most popular compromise is to hyphenate your last name and the last name of your groom. For example, if your groom's name is John Smith and your name is Kate Jones. You would name yourself Kate Jones-Smith or Kate Smith-Jones. This allows you to keep going by your own last name while legally adopting your husband's last name at the same time.

E) The compromise is the biggest reason that so many women choose to hyphenate their last names. It is a way of you keeping your own identity while also making your future husband happy. It allows you to stay connected to accomplishments that you achieved before you got married. For example, many women who choose to hyphenate do so partially because they have earned higher educational degrees and certifications under their maiden names. They might have also had things published or publicized and want to stay connected to that identity. Hyphenating your last name can help you bridge the gap between your personal and professional lives. Many women who opt to simply keep their own names do so because they don't want to give up all that they have accomplished professionally. Adopting their husband's last name makes it hard for them to claim ownership of these accomplishments personally because they happened under their "other" name.

F) While tradition is one thing, there isn't any logical reason to completely change your name. Keeping your name and joining it to your husband's through hyphenation is as legal as simply adopting his name or as simply keeping your own and leaving his out of the picture entirely.

G) Probably the most important reason to consider hyphenation is your identity. You've spent your whole life building your identity under a certain name. Obviously you will still be you even if you've taken on your husband's last name and omitted yours entirely. At the same time, your name is associated with the identity you've built up and hyphenation allows you to respect that while also respecting tradition and your husband's family's identity.

H) If you care about outside opinions on your name, you should know that a large portion of today's society is annoyed by the hyphenated name. Some people find it "snobby" (势利的) and others simply find it irritating because they have a hard time remembering which last name they are supposed to say first. Some people even believe that not simply adopting your husband's last name is a huge sign of disrespect and a lack of commitment.

I) It is possible that your future husband will find this choice offensive. Some men, regardless of how you might feel about some things, are traditionalists and feel that it is simply "right" for the woman to take the man's last name as her own. Whether your future husband insisting on your adopting his last name is a red flag to you or not, it is still something that you should take into consideration.

J) There are all sorts of reasons to hyphenate your name or not to hyphenate your name. The basis for each of these things, however, is whether or not you are willing to make a compromise when it comes to changing your name. The hyphenation is the epitome (体现) of a compromise. One spouse wants a complete name change. The other spouse wants no name change. Hyphenating the two names is a way for each person to, at least a little bit, "win" the argument.

K) And don't forget the legal stuff! Making the decision is just part of the process. From there you are going to have to legally change your name all over the place. You'll need to change your name at the bank, with social security, with your credit cards, on your driver's license, at the gym … everywhere. It's easy to get overwhelmed just thinking about it.

L) What matters, of course, is that the two of you are going to be happily married—hopefully for the rest of your lives. At the end of the day, whether you each keep your names, whether you come up with an entirely new name for the two of you to share or whether you hyphenate your current last names, what matters is that you love each other and are going to be joining your lives together. Try to remember that as you are staring at the application for your marriage license and filling out the portion that reads "name after you get married" (or whatever the legalese for that might be).
exam_sections.passage_title: Hyphenating your last name after marriage?

exam_sections.directions: There are 2 passages in this section. Each passage is followed by some questions or unfinished statements. For each of them there are four choices marked A), B), C) and D). You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre.
exam_sections.passage_content:
Passage One

It's good to be smart. After all, intelligent people earn more money, accumulate more wealth, and even live longer. But there's another side to the story. The brightest people and strongest leaders sometimes make errors others don't, especially in situations that require common sense.

Travis Bradberry, president at TalentSmart, explained Bradberry in his post Why Smart People Act so Stupid that "rational thinking and intelligence don't tend to go hand in hand". Intelligent people are more prone to silly mistakes because of blind spots in how they use logic. These blind spots exist because smart people tend to be overconfident in their reasoning abilities. "They're so used to being right and having quick answers that they don't even realise when they're making a mess by answering without thinking things through."

A lifetime of praise leads smart people to develop too much faith in their intelligence and abilities. They often fail to recognise when they need help, and when they do recognise it, they tend to believe that no one else is capable of providing it.

"It's hard for anyone to graciously accept the fact that they're wrong. It's even harder for smart people because they grow so used to being right all the time that it becomes a part of their identity," Bradberry wrote. "For smart people, being wrong can feel like a personal attack, and being right, a necessity."

Smart people also have a hard time accepting feedback. They tend to undervalue the opinions of others, which means they have trouble believing that anyone is qualified to give them useful feedback. Not only does this tendency hinder their growth and performance, it can lead to harmful relationships, both personally and professionally.

Smart people develop overachieving personalities because things come so easily to them. They simply don't understand how hard some people have to work to accomplish the same things, and because of that, they push people too hard. They set the bar too high, and when people take too long or don't get things quite right, they assume it's due to lack of effort. So they push even harder.

Passage Two

Of the endless troubles that come with being driven from one's home country, losing educational certificates may seem small. But it isn't. Refugees who settle in other countries often find themselves unable to continue on their previous career path due to a new set of employer standards or skills requirements. To solve this problem, the U.S. State Department is posing a solution: online learning.

The State Department will announce a partnership with an online education platform called Coursera. The platform will allow refugees worldwide to take thousands of online courses for free. "Coursera for Refugees" will be available for any non-profit group that supports refugees in any country, as well as individual refugees. They can apply for fully funded access to Coursera's course catalog, which means they can take all of the platform's classes and obtain professional certificates for free. The platform currently offers professor-led lectures on a broad range of topics, from data science to fashion design.

As the world migrant crisis intensifies, employment is becoming a global concern. The new program aims to aid refugees by offering "important skills that will help them in the global economy," Evan Ryan, U.S. assistant secretary of state for educational and cultural affairs, said on a press call last week. "What we don't want to do is not act," added Coursera chief operations officer Lila Ibrahim.

The idea isn't without its kinks. For one, starting on a new career path is not as simple as watching a few videos and obtaining an online certificate; even those looking to continue previous careers can't simply rely on an online lecture to get them up-to-date on standards, policies, and practices. For another, most of the classes on Coursera are in English, and though there are plans to add translations, language barriers can be a big obstacle. Then there are the questions over the value of massive open online courses (MOOCs) themselves—both for refugees and for average learners.

But it's still early days and there are signs of hope. In 2015, a joint study found 72% of people taking MOOCs saw career benefits afterward.

exam_sections.directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to translate a passage from Chinese into English. You should write your answer on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.translation_content: 随着生活水平的提高，更多人开始加入到自驾游的行列之中。自驾游者既可驾驶自家车也可借车或租车出游。司机可能是车主或结伴出游者。自驾游与传统的组团旅游不同，它能够更好地满足旅游者的个性化需求，使他们更好地享受旅游的过程。自驾游尤其受到年轻出游者的欢迎。年轻人追求独立自由的生活，而自驾游恰好满足了他们的这一需求。
exam_sections.translation_requirements: 请将以下中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法正确和表达流畅

exam_questions.question_text: Write an account of a career planning seminar you have taken part in and summarize what you have learned from it.
exam_questions.analysis: 写作题目，需要学生根据要求写一篇关于职业规划研讨会的报告，并总结从中获得的收获
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的议论文写作能力，包括内容组织、观点表达和语言运用能力

exam_questions.question_text: What is the news report mainly about?
exam_questions.options: ["A) A proposed policy allowing Africans to travel in Africa without a visa.", "B) An agreement among 13 African countries to set up a free-trade zone.", "C) A plan to invite all African countries to join the African Union.", "D) An important initiative to permit tourists to visit Africa without a visa."]
exam_questions.analysis: 主旨大意题。新闻开头便提到非洲领导人计划将非洲大陆变成一个没有边界的大陆，他们将推行一项单一护照政策，允许国家之间的自由流动；非洲联盟希望取消非洲人访问其他非洲国家的签证要求。由此可知，这篇新闻报道的主要内容是关于一项拟议政策，这项政策允许非洲人免签证在非洲旅行。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'African leaders plan to turn the continent into a continent without borders. They will introduce a single passport policy, allowing free movement between countries.' 和 'The African Union...wants to abolish the requirement of a visa for Africans visiting other African countries.'

exam_questions.question_text: What benefit will a free-trade deal bring to African economy?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It will attract more investments from all over the world.", "B) It will help many African countries reduce trade deficits.", "C) It will reduce the cost of trade between African countries.", "D) It will allow Africans to play a bigger role in world trade."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到，非洲联盟还希望不久的将来在整个非洲大陆建立自由贸易协定，因为非洲大陆内部的贸易成本高于任何其他地区。由此可知，自由贸易协定将降低非洲国家之间的贸易成本。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'It also wants to establish a free-trade deal across the continent in the near future, as trade within the African continent costs more than any other region.'

exam_questions.question_text: What new method has been developed to help fight climate change?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Cooling down volcanic rock with sea water.", "B) Storing carbon dioxide underground as a gas.", "C) Capturing carbon dioxide and burying it under the sea.", "D) Pumping carbon dioxide underground to form stone."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到，为应对气候变化而开发的新方法是将二氧化碳泵入地下形成石头。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'Researchers in Iceland found a new way of tackling climate change by pumping carbon dioxide underground and turning it into stone.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is a potential difficulty in applying the new technique?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Lack of burying ground.", "B) Long time for processing.", "C) High consumption of water.", "D) Enormous cost of energy."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到，每埋一吨二氧化碳需要二十五吨水。由此可推知，应用这项新技术的潜在困难是耗水量大。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'One potential difficulty is that for each ton of carbon dioxide buried, the technique requires 25 tons of water.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the news report say about French people's bread consumption?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It varies with the seasons.", "B) It has been on the decline.", "C) It has caused nationwide concern.", "D) It is ninety grams daily on average."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到，法国人的面包消耗量正在下降。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'...bread consumption is on the decline, with French people eating nine grams less than in the previous year.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about French women from the report?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They emphasize food variety.", "B) They prefer French stick loaves.", "C) They do more cooking than men.", "D) They favor diets lower in calories."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。新闻中指出法国人向低卡路里饮食的转变是面包消耗量减少的一个因素，且如今法国女性每天只吃80到90克面包。由此推知，法国女性的日常饮食发生了变化，她们更倾向于卡路里较低的饮食。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'the association cited changing diets...the switch to those low in calories, as a factor in the reduction of bread consumption' 和 'Nowadays...whereas women eat 80 to 90 grams.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is said about lifestyle changes of the French people?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They bake more bread at home.", "B) They spend less time eating breakfast.", "C) They eat more fruit than they used to.", "D) They put jam instead of butter on bread."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到，现在法国人在早餐上的时间更少了。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'The second reason...is lifestyle changes in the country, with people dedicating less time to breakfast...'

exam_questions.question_text: When would the man like to leave for London?
exam_questions.options: ["A) After the rush hour.", "B) Early in the morning.", "C) As soon as possible.", "D) Around lunch time."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中男士想要在早高峰之后动身前往伦敦。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Well, after the rush hour, I think. We'd like to avoid the crowds if possible. So probably sometime around 10 o'clock.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the man's other request?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Two first class seats.", "B) Two seats together.", "C) One window seat.", "D) One seat near the exit."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中男士的其他请求是想订一个靠窗的座位。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Is there any chance we could have a window seat for one of those?'

exam_questions.question_text: Where should the man wait for the train?
exam_questions.options: ["A) In the middle of the platform.", "B) At the far end of the platform.", "C) Behind the yellow line.", "D) In the waiting room."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中女士提到，男士应该在站台尽头等待火车。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'All you need to do is wait at the far end of the platform...'

exam_questions.question_text: What should the man do to collect the bicycles?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Wait in a queue for his turn.", "B) Go to the baggage claim area.", "C) Pay an extra fee for the service.", "D) Give the ticket to the train guard."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中女士提到，男士若要领走自行车，应该把车票交给列车长。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'When you arrive in London, hand the ticket to the guard and he will return the bicycles to you.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about hat factories in Britain?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Almost all of them were operating at a deficit.", "B) They have all been turned into movie theatres.", "C) Nearly all of them closed down decades ago.", "D) They have adapted to meet fashion changes."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中提到，几乎所有的英国帽子工厂在几十年前就倒闭了。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'There used to be many hat factories in Britain until around the 1950s. But fashion changed and most people stopped wearing hats. So practically all of those factories had to close down.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is special about Cube Movie Theatre?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It shows foreign movies exclusively.", "B) It shows movies from the 1950s.", "C) It is the oldest theatre in London.", "D) It is located next to a hat factory."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中提到，"立方"电影院的特别之处是它只放映外国电影。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'We're the only movie theatre in the whole country that only shows foreign movies.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the man say about most people in London?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They wear hats on social occasions.", "B) They don't speak foreign languages.", "C) They enjoy watching foreign movies.", "D) They don't go to movie theatres often."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中男士提到，在男士看来，大多数伦敦人不说外语。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'I would have thought that in London most people don't speak foreign languages.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman say about foreign movies shown in London?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are meant mostly for immigrants.", "B) They attract large crowds of young Londoners.", "C) They are hard for English people to appreciate.", "D) They have an English translation on the screen."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中女士提到，在伦敦上映的外国电影的屏幕上都会有英文翻译。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'...all movies come with English text at the bottom of the screen. So even if you don't understand what the actors say, you can still read it.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about Astrid Natley, a secondary school math teacher?
exam_questions.options: ["A) She doesn't think smartphones can replace tablets.", "B) She incorporates smartphones into her teaching.", "C) She cannot stop children using smartphones.", "D) She regards smartphones as a distraction."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，中学数学老师Astrid Natley将智能手机融入她的教学中。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Astrid Natley, a secondary school math teacher, incorporates phones into her classroom.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why does Helen Lockhart, a registered nurse, support a complete ban on smartphone use in the classroom?
exam_questions.options: ["A) To enforce school discipline.", "B) To make students concentrate.", "C) To help children grow up to be professionals.", "D) To cultivate children's good study habits."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，注册护士Helen Lockhart支持在课堂上全面禁止使用智能手机，并且她用自己的例子来表示他们需要教孩子们如何像他们努力成为的专业人士那样行事，即帮助孩子们成长为专业人士。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'I'm banned from mobile use at work...If I am caught with it...I will be subject to disciplinary procedure...We need to teach children how to behave like the professional they are striving to become.'

exam_questions.question_text: What should students do in the classroom according to Richard Stone, an English teacher?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Use books and pens only.", "B) Cut down their screen time.", "C) Make full use of electronic devices.", "D) Learn to use the internet for research."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，英语老师Richard Stone认为学校和家之间应该有明确的界限，让学生们把手机和笔记本电脑放在家里，在课堂上看到一个不一样的书本和笔的世界，即在课堂上使用书本和笔。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'...so let's leave phones and laptops at home, and show them a different world in their lessons—one of books and pens.'

exam_questions.question_text: How did Kate earn the reward from her mother?
exam_questions.options: ["A) By cleaning the kitchen floor.", "B) By looking after her baby brother.", "C) By helping her mother do the dishes.", "D) By helping her brother wash windows."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章开篇便提到，Kate是通过帮助她的哥哥清洗窗户，以得到她妈妈许诺的奖励。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Kate...helped her brother wash windows to get a reward promised by her mother.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did Kate do after her mother left the room?
exam_questions.options: ["A) She ordered a large number of dolls.", "B) She checked if a purple doll was ordered.", "C) She mistakenly canceled her mom's order.", "D) She ordered a more expensive doll instead."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中先提到Kate的妈妈离开房间后，Kate自己将很多洋娃娃加入购物车并全部下了单，即Kate在妈妈离开房间后在网上订购了大量洋娃娃。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'15 minutes and a few clicks later, with more than $350 worth of dolls in her cart, Kate placed the order and ran off to play.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did Kate's family do after the packages arrived?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They asked the children's hospital to pick them.", "B) They took all of them to the children's hospital.", "C) They opened all of them one by one.", "D) They discussed where to keep them."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中先提到Kate一家在收到包裹之后，在Kate爸爸的建议下，把所有包裹（洋娃娃）都送给了当地的儿童医院。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Kate's family loaded up their car and took all the dolls to the playroom at the children's hospital.'

exam_questions.question_text: According to recent research conducted in Australia, what has a lasting impact on one's life?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The time one starts school.", "B) The classroom atmosphere.", "C) The school that one attends.", "D) The relationship with classmates."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，根据澳大利亚最近进行的一项研究，入学时间对一个人的生活有持久的影响。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'The researchers found that the time when a person starts school has an enduring impact on their lives.'

exam_questions.question_text: What was the purpose of the Australian research?
exam_questions.options: ["A) To help parents decide when to send their children to school.", "B) To find causes for differences in the participants' performance.", "C) To identify students having potential to be professional athletes.", "D) To offer constructive suggestions for making educational policies."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，澳大利亚研究人员想找出是什么导致了这些差异，他们怀疑年长、成熟的学生比同龄人更自信，因为他们取得了更好的成绩，为了检验这一想法，他们进行了两项研究。由此可推知，澳大利亚的这项研究目的是找出参与者表现存在差异的原因。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'But the Australian researchers wanted to discover what was driving these differences. They suspected older, more mature students obtained more self-confidence than their peers because they achieved better grades. To test this out, they conducted two studies.'

exam_questions.question_text: Who were the participants in the researchers' first study?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Political leaders.", "B) Financial analysts.", "C) Professional athletes.", "D) High-school students."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，研究人员第一项研究的参与者是高中生。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'In the first study, more than 600 high school students were surveyed about their tendency to take risks and feel confident.'

exam_questions.question_text: According to the researchers, what is one characteristic of successful people?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Leadership ability.", "B) Commitment to work.", "C) Risk-taking.", "D) Self-confidence."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，虽然冒险可能被认为是一种负面的特质，但它也是成功人士的一个特征，即成功人士的一个特征是冒险。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'While risk-taking can be considered a negative attribute, it's also a characteristic of successful people.'

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 副词辨析题。空格所在句子主干结构完整，且空格位于主语Authors, artists and children和谓语have dreamed of之间，故可判断空格处应填入一副词作状语。备选项中，只有O选项alike（同样地）入选，将其代入文中，意为"不管是作家、艺术家还是儿童，都梦想着收到这样一份来自大海的礼物"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: alike表示"同样地、相似地"，这里指作家、艺术家和儿童都有同样的梦想。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 分词辨析题。空格所在句中，it作主语，found作谓语，itself作宾语，空格后为介词短语by...plastic eggs，可判断空格处应填入一分词。结合上文提到的发生在该岛的事情——成千上万个玩具蛋被冲上岸可推断，空格所填词表达"受到某种遭遇"之意。备选项中，只有D选项struck（侵袭）代入文中，意为"它受到了大量涌入的彩色塑料蛋侵袭"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: struck是strike的过去分词，表示"侵袭、打击"，这里指小岛被大量的塑料蛋侵袭。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格位于定冠词the和介词短语of local children之间，故空格处应填入一名词或动名词。空格所在部分意为"当地的孩子们非常______，因为这些蛋含有玩具"。结合常识可知，孩子们通常都喜欢玩具。由此可推断，空格所在部分应表达孩子们的喜悦之情，故空格所填词应含有"开心、愉快"之意。备选项中，只有L选项delight（高兴、愉快）符合句意及语境，且to the delight of sb.是固定搭配，意为"令人感到高兴"。
exam_questions.explanation: delight表示"高兴、愉快"，to the delight of是固定搭配，意为"令...高兴的是"。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格位于名词Police和the eggs之间，名词Police作主语，省略引导词that的宾语从句作宾语，句中缺少谓语，故空格处应填入一动词。空格所在部分意为"警方______这些玩具蛋来自一艘货船"。结合上文提到的成千上万个玩具蛋被冲上岸可知，此处应是警方对这些玩具蛋的来源做了推测或发表了观点。备选项中，只有C选项suspect（怀疑、猜想）代入文中，意为"警方怀疑这些玩具蛋来自一艘货船"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: suspect表示"怀疑、猜想"，这里指警方推测这些蛋的来源。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格位于名词短语an unusually ______ storm中，故空格处应填入形容词或分词作定语，修饰storm。空格所在部分意为"货船在一场异常______风暴中丢失了部分货物，这场风暴是2006年以来德国东北海岸遭遇的最严重的一场"。由此可推测这场风暴的强度很大，故空格所填词应含有"强烈、猛烈"之意。备选项中，将I选项intense（强烈的、剧烈的）代入文中，意为"这艘货船在一场异常强烈的风暴中丢失了部分货物"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: intense表示"强烈的、剧烈的"，形容风暴的强度很大。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格位于主语the joy of the moment和副词off之间，句中缺少谓语，故空格处应填入一动词，且该动词能够与off构成合理搭配。空格所在句意为"然而，这一刻的喜悦很快______"，结合该句中表转折的However及上文提到的这些令人惊喜的蛋已经成为孩子的战利品这一暗含喜悦之情的内容可推断，空格所在部分应表达"喜悦之情很快消失或转变为消极情绪"之意。备选项中，A选项wore这一动词可与副词off搭配构成短语动词wore off（wear off的过去式，意为"消逝、逐渐停止"），代入文中，意为"这一刻的喜悦很快就消逝了"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: wear off表示"逐渐消失、消退"，这里指喜悦之情很快消退了。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格位于because引导的原因状语从句中，其中，everything作主语，was为系动词或助动词，但因so在此处为副词，且空格后没有其他成分，故判断was在此处为系动词，空格处应填入形容词作表语。空格所在部分意为"起初我认为这是一件奇事，因为一切都如此______"，由此可推测空格所填词应能体现"奇"这一特征。备选项中，将M选项colorful（有趣的、丰富多彩的）代入文中，意为"起初我认为这是一件奇事，因为一切都如此有趣"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: colorful表示"丰富多彩的、有趣的"，这里形容整个场景很有趣。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格位于that引导的宾语从句中，其中，this作主语，is为系动词，a huge ______作表语，介词短语in the end作状语，故空格处应填入一单数可数名词。空格所在部分意为"但是后来我们意识到，这终究是一个巨大的______"，上文提到，起初市长认为成千上万个玩具蛋被冲上岸是一件奇事，因为一切都如此有趣，再结合空格所在部分中表转折的but可推断，空格所填名词应表达消极含义。备选项中，H选项mess（麻烦、困境）和N选项bore（令人厌烦的事）入选，二者的区别在于，mess表示客观的困境，bore表示主观上令人厌烦的事情，由后文提到的被冲到岛上的塑料袋和其他材料带来了严重的问题可知，mess更符合语境。将H选项代入文中，意为"但后来我们意识到，这终究是一个巨大的麻烦"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: mess表示"混乱、麻烦"，这里指大量的塑料蛋带来了环境问题。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格位于省略引导词that的宾语从句中，其中，the plastic bags and other materials作主语，that引导的定语从句修饰主语，can cause作谓语，serious problems作宾语，介词短语for ______作状语，故空格处应填入一不可数名词、可数名词的复数形式或动名词作介词for的宾语。空格所在句意为"他还指出，被冲到岛上的塑料袋和其他材料会对______造成严重的问题"。结合常识可知，海岸上的塑料以及其他垃圾会对一些生物和生态环境带来不良影响，由此可推测空格所填词应与某些生物或生态环境有关。备选项中，将B选项wildlife（野生动物）代入文中，意为"被冲到岛上的塑料袋和其他材料会给野生动植物带来严重的问题"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: wildlife表示"野生动物"，这里指塑料垃圾对野生动物造成威胁。

exam_questions.options: ["A) wore", "B) wildlife", "C) suspect", "D) struck", "E) similar", "F) quantity", "G) overthrown", "H) mess", "I) intense", "J) human", "K) effective", "L) delight", "M) colorful", "N) bore", "O) alike"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格所在句中，代词They作主语，名词notes作宾语，介词短语from afar作状语，或作后置定语修饰notes，句中缺少谓语，故空格处应填入一动词。空格所在句意为"它们从远方______便条"或"它们______来自远方的便条"。空格所在句上句提到，"不过，除了玩具外，所有这些小蛋内都还有额外的乐趣"。由此可推测，"额外的乐趣"指的是玩具蛋中的便条，即玩具蛋内有便条，空格处应填入能体现便条与玩具蛋之间的包含关系的词。备选项中，将N选项bore（bear的过去式，意为"携带"）代入文中，意为"它们带着来自远方的便条"，符合语义及语境。
exam_questions.explanation: bore是bear的过去式，表示"携带、带有"，这里指蛋里面带有便条。

exam_questions.question_text: Many people today still find name hyphenation upon marriage unacceptable.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，当今社会有很大一部分人对连字符的名字感到恼火。题干中的 Many people today、name hyphenation 和 unacceptable 分别与该句中的 a large portion of today's society、the hyphenated name 和 is annoyed 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: H段第一句：'If you care about outside opinions on your name, you should know that a large portion of today's society is annoyed by the hyphenated name.'

exam_questions.question_text: As a compromise, a bride will in most cases adopt a name that combines the couple's last names.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，大多数时候，最普遍的妥协方式是把你的姓氏和新郎的姓氏用连字符连接。题干中的 compromise、in most cases 和 combines the couple's last names 分别与该句中的 compromise、Most of the time 和 hyphenate your last name and the last name of your groom 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: D段倒数第二句：'Most of the time, though, the most popular compromise is to hyphenate your last name and the last name of your groom.'

exam_questions.question_text: The bride should consider adopting her groom's last name whether he feels strongly about it or not.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，无论你未来的丈夫坚持让你随他姓对你来说是不是一个危险信号，这都是你应该考虑的事情。题干中的 should consider、adopting her groom's last name 和 feels strongly 分别与该句中的 should take into consideration、adopting his last name 和 insisting on 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: I段最后一句：'Whether your future husband insisting on your adopting his last name is a red flag to you or not, it is still something that you should take into consideration.'

exam_questions.question_text: Making preparations for marriage causes a lot of stress.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，结婚的过程可能很劳心。题干中的 Making preparations for marriage 和 a lot of stress 分别与该句中的 the act of getting married 和 quite stressful 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: A段第二句：'While being married is great and wonderful, the act of getting married can be quite stressful.'

exam_questions.question_text: Hyphenating the last names could be a win-win solution should arguments arise about what name to adopt upon marriage.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，使用连字符连接两者的姓氏至少在一定程度上是一种双"赢"的方式。题干中的 arguments 为原词再现，Hyphenating the last names 和 a win-win solution 分别与该句中的 Hyphenating the two names 和 a way for each person to..."win"相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: J段最后一句：'Hyphenating the two names is a way for each person to, at least a little bit, "win" the argument.'

exam_questions.question_text: It used to be considered socially unacceptable for a bride to retain her maiden name.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位句提到，在以前，新娘保留自己姓氏的行为被认为是禁忌。题干中的 a bride 为原文再现，used to 与定位句中的 Once upon a time 相对应，be considered socially unacceptable 和 retain her maiden name 分别与定位句中的 was considered taboo 和 keeping her own last name 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: B段第二、三句：'Once upon a time, it was just customary for a bride to take her groom's last name as her own and abandon her maiden name completely. The act of keeping her own last name was considered taboo.'

exam_questions.question_text: The bride who adopts a hyphenated last name after marriage can maintain connections with their past achievements.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，这使你能够与你婚前取得的成就保持关联。结合上文可知，该句中的this指代使用连字符连接姓氏。题干中的 maintain connections with their past achievements 与该句中的 stay connected to accomplishments that you achieved before you got married 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: E段第三句：'It allows you to stay connected to accomplishments that you achieved before you got married.'

exam_questions.question_text: Hyphenating names allows the bride to preserve her own identity while respecting tradition.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，你的名字与你已经建立起的身份相关，使用连字符使你在尊重自己的身份的同时，也尊重了传统。题干中的 while respecting tradition 为原文再现，Hyphenating names 和 her own identity 分别与该句中的 hyphenation 和 the identity you've built up 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: G段最后一句：'At the same time, your name is associated with the identity you've built up and hyphenation allows you to respect that while also respecting tradition and your husband's family's identity.'

exam_questions.question_text: No matter what name the bride adopts, it is most important that the newlyweds truly love each other.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位句提到，无论你们是否各自保留自己的姓氏，是否想出一个两人共享的全新姓氏，或是否将目前的姓氏用连字符连接，重要的是你们彼此相爱，共度余生。题干中的 No matter what name the bride adopts、important 和 the newlyweds...love each other 分别与该句中的 whether you each keep your names, whether you come up with an entirely new name for the two of you to share or whether you hyphenate your current last names、matters 和 you love each other 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: L段第二句：'At the end of the day, whether you each keep your names, whether you come up with an entirely new name for the two of you to share or whether you hyphenate your current last names, what matters is that you love each other and are going to be joining your lives together.'

exam_questions.question_text: Legally speaking, the bride is free to choose whatever name she prefers.
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位句提到，保留你的姓氏并通过连字符把它与你丈夫的姓氏联合在一起，和仅采用他的姓氏，或仅保留你自己的姓氏而把他的姓氏完全排除在外一样合法。题干是对该句的合理概括，其中 Legally 与该句中的 legal 相对应，free to choose whatever name she prefers 与该句中的 Keeping your name and joining it to your husband's through hyphenation...simply adopting his name or...simply keeping your own and leaving his out of the picture entirely 相对应。
exam_questions.explanation: F段第二句：'Keeping your name and joining it to your husband's through hyphenation is as legal as simply adopting his name or as simply keeping your own and leaving his out of the picture entirely.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the passage about the brightest people?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They can make silly mistakes in straightforward situations.", "B) They usually turn a blind eye to their own weaknesses.", "C) They are admired by people around them.", "D) They can differ in their personalities."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章提到，最聪明的人有时会犯别人不会犯的错误，尤其是在需要常识的情况下，而需要常识的情况也就是简单的情况，即最聪明的人会在面对简单的情况时犯愚蠢的错误。A选项内容是对文章第一段第四句的同义转述。
exam_questions.explanation: 第一段第四句：'The brightest people and strongest leaders sometimes make errors others don't, especially in situations that require common sense.'

exam_questions.question_text: What accounts for the existence of intelligent people's logical blind spots?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Their irrational way of thinking.", "B) Too much faith in their ability to think.", "C) Their ignorance of behavioural science.", "D) Too much concern about their work."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，聪明人在运用逻辑的方式上存在盲点，而这些盲点的存在是因为他们往往对自己的推理能力过于自信。由此可知，聪明人会有逻辑盲点是因为他们对自己的思考能力过于自信。B选项内容是对文章第二段第三句的同义转述。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段第三句：'These blind spots exist because smart people tend to be overconfident in their reasoning abilities.'

exam_questions.question_text: How do smart people react when they are found to be wrong?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They shift the blame to others.", "B) They graciously accept the facts.", "C) They may feel shocked.", "D) They may get offended."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，对于聪明人来说，犯错就像是受到了一种人身攻击。由此可知，当被别人发现自己犯错的时候，聪明人可能会感觉受到了人身攻击，觉得被冒犯了。D选项内容是对文章第四段第三句前半部分的同义转述。
exam_questions.explanation: 第四段第三句：'For smart people, being wrong can feel like a personal attack, and being right, a necessity.'

exam_questions.question_text: What may happen to smart people who find it difficult to accept suggestions?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They may suffer in their professional and private life.", "B) They may lose faith in their administrative abilities.", "C) They may commit more errors than ever before.", "D) They may experience a lot of emotional stress."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，聪明人很难接受反馈意见；他们倾向于轻视别人的意见，且这种倾向可能对他们的人际关系造成危害，包括私人关系和职业关系。由此可知，对于那些很难接受他人建议的聪明人来说，他们可能在职业和私人生活中吃苦头。A选项内容是对文章第五段第三句后半部分的同义转述。
exam_questions.explanation: 第五段第三句：'Not only does this tendency hinder their growth and performance, it can lead to harmful relationships, both personally and professionally.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is said about those working with or under overachieving people?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They put a lot of effort into their work.", "B) They set higher goals for themselves.", "C) They are under increasing pressure.", "D) They take less time to get things done."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，聪明人会养成争强好胜的性格，他们根本不明白对他们来说很容易的事情，有些人要完成的话需要付出多努力，所以他们会把人逼得太紧；聪明人把标准定得过高，并且当别人做事花了太长时间或做得不太好时，他们就认为这是由于别人不够努力，然后会把人逼得更紧。由此可知，和争强好胜的人共事或者在其领导下工作的人会面临越来越大的压力。C选项内容是对文章第六段的合理概括。
exam_questions.explanation: 第六段描述：'Smart people develop overachieving personalities because things come so easily to them. They simply don't understand how hard some people have to work to accomplish the same things, and because of that, they push people too hard. They set the bar too high, and when people take too long or don't get things quite right, they assume it's due to lack of effort. So they push even harder.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why is the U.S. State Department launching an online learning program for refugees?
exam_questions.options: ["A) To enable them to settle down in host countries.", "B) To allow them to learn as many job skills as possible.", "C) To offer them a platform to pursue advanced degrees.", "D) To help them to meet new employment standards."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，由于有一套新的雇主标准或技能要求，在其他国家定居的难民无法继续之前的职业道路；为了解决这个问题，美国国务院提出一个解决方案：在线学习。由此可知，美国国务院为难民发起在线学习项目是为了帮助难民达到新的就业标准以实现继续就业。
exam_questions.explanation: 第一段第三、四句：'Refugees who settle in other countries often find themselves unable to continue on their previous career path due to a new set of employer standards or skills requirements. To solve this problem, the U.S. State Department is posing a solution: online learning.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we know about "Coursera for Refugees"?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It provides refugees with a wide range of courses free of charge.", "B) It offers free online data services for refugees around the world.", "C) It allows refugees to obtain degrees in various academic fields.", "D) It supplies refugees with a great variety of job opportunities."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。文章中提到，"Coursera for Refugees"面向各国所有支持难民的非营利组织以及难民个人；他们可以申请全额资助进入Coursera课程目录，即可以免费学习该平台的所有课程；另外，该平台目前提供的讲座涉及了广泛的主题。由此可知，"Coursera for Refugees"免费为难民提供各种课程。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段第三至五句：'"Coursera for Refugees" will be available for any non-profit group that supports refugees in any country, as well as individual refugees. They can apply for fully funded access to Coursera's course catalog, which means they can take all of the platform's classes and obtain professional certificates for free. The platform currently offers professor-led lectures on a broad range of topics, from data science to fashion design.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the passage say is a consequence of the global migrant crisis?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Instability increases in host countries.", "B) The global economic crisis intensifies.", "C) A lot more refugees die during migration.", "D) Refugees find it more difficult to get a job."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，随着世界移民危机的加剧，就业已成为全球关注的问题。由此可知，世界移民危机带来的后果之一便是就业问题，即移民更难找到工作。
exam_questions.explanation: 第三段第一句：'As the world migrant crisis intensifies, employment is becoming a global concern.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author say causes refugees' difficulty in taking online courses?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Cultural environment.", "B) Changed academic requirements.", "C) Lack of language skills.", "D) Difference in teaching platforms."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，Coursera上的大部分课程都是英文版，尽管有添加译文的计划，但语言障碍对学习者来说可能是一个很大的弊端。由此可知，难民学习Coursera上的在线课程会面临困难是因为他们缺乏语言技能。
exam_questions.explanation: 第四段第三句：'For another, most of the classes on Coursera are in English, and though there are plans to add translations, language barriers can be a big obstacle.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did the joint study find about the MOOCs several years ago?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They helped solve learners' financial problems.", "B) They benefited most of the learners.", "C) They changed some learners' career path.", "D) They provided the most needed vocational skills."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，2015年，一项联合研究发现，72%参加了慕课的人在后来体验到了其对职业发展的好处。由此可知，几年前一项联合研究发现，慕课让大多数学习者受益。
exam_questions.explanation: 第五段第二句：'In 2015, a joint study found 72% of people taking MOOCs saw career benefits afterward.'

exam_questions.question_text: Translate the Chinese passage into English.
exam_questions.analysis: 翻译题目，需要学生将中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法、词汇和句式结构的正确性
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的汉译英能力，包括词汇选择、语法结构、句式转换和语言表达的准确性
